intro: Cochlearia foetida, commonly known as the stinking candytuft, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically lobed or divided. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in coastal areas or along riverbanks. The plant is characterized by its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in bloom.
